name: Winter Squash
pros: Squash is a dense, filling food despite being fairly low in calories with a low glycemic index and load.
The protein and unsaturated oils from the seeds may also have a moderating effect on blood sugar.
Compounds in squash like beta-carotene and lutein are classified as flavonoids that may help to protect human cells from the damaging effects of oxygen.
Flavonoids have a role in affecting or inhibiting cancer cell growth.
Winter squash is rich in potassium which can help to counteract the deleterious effects of sodium on blood pressure.
High in both vitamin C and beta-carotene can help boost immunity
